Thrain Ironvein’s earliest memories were of the echoing stone halls beneath Mount Hyarmud, where his family meticulously maintained the ancient steam conduits that powered the Dwarven stronghold’s forges. Unlike most of his kin who embraced the rhythmic clang of hammers, Thrain was drawn to the quiet wisdom of the Anvil of Lore, the stronghold’s sacred archive, devouring texts on theology and engineering under the stern tutelage of High Priestess Borin Stonehand. His sharp mind earned him a rare scholarship to the Imperial Academy in Altlia, where he spent decades studying the divine mysteries of the Goddess of Mercy amidst humans and elves, mastering healing magic while sketching intricate schematics of holy relics. Yet his academic ascent shattered when raiders from the disgraced Black Anvil clan—led by his former friend, the disgruntled engineer Kragg Grimbeard—ambushed Hyarmud, seeking the legendary Heartstone Forgehammer. world_context.world_description: Nestled on the western edge of the Alframe Continent, Kokuyō no Mori is a mist-shrouded woodland where ancient oaks twist into serpentine shapes and bamboo groves hum with unnatural winds. Once a sacred hunting ground for the samurai clans of the lost Shizuka Empire, the forest now harbors forgotten ruins, cursed beasts, and the remnants of a centuries-old calamity. The air reeks of damp earth and iron, and the canopy above is so dense that sunlight filters through only as pale, ghostly rays. Villagers whisper of the "Night of the Crimson Oni," a legend claiming that a bloodthirsty demon was sealed here after slaughtering an entire province. At the forest’s heart lies the **Shrine of the Ninefold Veil**, a moss-covered sanctuary guarded by reclusive shrine maidens who perform rituals to keep the demon’s prison intact. Surrounding it are the crumbling estates of the Shizuka clan, now overgrown and haunted by yōkai—spirits that mimic the forms of the long-dead warriors who once ruled here. The region’s roads are treacherous, patrolled by mercenary bands and the **Guren-tai**, a rogue guild of treasure hunters seeking the demon’s hoarded gold. Despite its dangers, Kokuyō no Mori is a place of fascination: ancient mechanisms hum beneath the soil, and strange symbols glow faintly on stones, hinting at a deeper mystery tied to the forest’s cursed heart.
